cards.name: Chikorita
cards.text: It uses the leaf on its head to determine the temperature and humidity. It loves to sunbathe.

attacks.name: Blot
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Bayleef
cards.text: The buds that ring its neck give off a spicy aroma that perks people up.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Meganium

abilities.name: Overgrow
abilities.text: If this Pokémon's remaining HP is 50 or less, its attacks do 70 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: Meganium's breath has the power to revive dead grass and plants. It can make them healthy again.

attacks.name: Green Force
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Seedot
cards.text: When it dangles from a tree branch, it looks just like an acorn. It enjoys scaring other Pokémon.

cards.name: Kricketot
cards.text: When its antennae hit each other, it sounds like the music of a xylophone.

attacks.name: Bug Hunch
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Grass Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Kricketune
cards.text: It signals its emotions with its melodies. Scientists are studying these melodic patterns.

attacks.name: Screech
attacks.text: During your next turn, any damage done to the Defending Pokémon by attacks is increased by 60 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Petilil
cards.text: Since they prefer moist, nutrient-rich soil, the areas where Petilil live are known to be good for growing plants.

attacks.name: Aromatherapy
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from each of your Pokémon.

cards.name: Lilligant
cards.text: Even veteran Trainers face a challenge in getting its beautiful flower to bloom. This Pokémon is popular with celebrities.

attacks.name: Boo-Hoo
attacks.text: If your opponent attaches an Energy card from his or her hand to the Defending Pokémon during his or her next turn, that Pokémon will be Asleep.

attacks.name: Leaf Slice
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Durant
cards.text: They attack in groups, covering themselves in steel armor to protect themselves from Heatmor.

attacks.name: Mountain Munch
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Scrape Down
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, discard the top 4 cards of your opponent's deck.

cards.name: Growlithe
cards.text: It has a brave and trustworthy nature. It fearlessly stands up to bigger and stronger foes.

cards.name: Arcanine
cards.text: Its magnificent bark conveys a sense of majesty. Anyone hearing it can't help but grovel before it.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Numel
cards.text: The magma in its body reaches 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit. Its hump gets smaller when it uses Fire-type moves.

cards.name: Camerupt
cards.text: If angered, the humps on its back erupt in a shower of molten lava. It lives in the craters of volcanoes.

attacks.name: Eruption
attacks.text: Each player discards the top card of his or her deck. This attack does 60 more damage for each Energy card discarded in this way.

cards.name: Emboar-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Spiral Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Strong Flare
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Heatmor
cards.text: It draws in air through its tail, transforms it into fire, and uses it like a tongue. It melts Durant and eats them.

attacks.name: Reinforced Flame
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Psyduck
cards.text: It has mystical powers but doesn't recall that it has used them. That is why it always looks puzzled.

cards.name: Golduck
cards.text: The forelegs are webbed, helping to make it an adept swimmer. It can be seen swimming elegantly in lakes, etc.

attacks.name: Derail
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Golduck BREAK

abilities.name: Hyper Transfer
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a basic Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

cards.text: BREAK Evolution Rule: Golduck BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

cards.name: Slowpoke
cards.text: It lazes vacantly near water. If something bites its tail, it won't even notice for a whole day.

attacks.name: Tail Lure
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Slowbro
cards.text: When a Slowpoke went hunting in the sea, its tail was bitten by a Shellder. That made it evolve into Slowbro.

attacks.name: Careless Head
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 more damage.

attacks.name: Walk-Off Homer
attacks.text: If you use this attack when you have only 1 Prize card left, you win this game.

cards.name: Slowking

abilities.name: Royal Flash
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, move an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon to 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

cards.text: When its head was bitten, toxins entered Slowpoke's head and unlocked an extraordinary power.

attacks.name: Psych Up
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Psych Up attack does 40 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Shellder
cards.text: Clamping on to an opponent reveals its vulnerable parts, so it uses this move only as a last resort.

attacks.name: Razor Shell
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

cards.name: Shellder
cards.text: Clamping on to an opponent reveals its vulnerable parts, so it uses this move only as a last resort.

attacks.name: Clamp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Cloyster
cards.text: Its shell is extremely hard. It cannot be shattered, even with a bomb. The shell opens only when it is attacking.

attacks.name: Sudden Grip
attacks.text: If this Pokémon evolved from Shellder during this turn, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Staryu
cards.text: It appears in large numbers by seashores. At night, its central core flashes with a red light.

cards.name: Gyarados-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Stormy Seas
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, search your deck for a Water Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Splash Burn
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: M Gyarados-EX
cards.text: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.,Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Blast Geyser
attacks.text: You may do 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, discard the top 2 cards of your deck.

cards.name: Lapras
cards.text: Its high intelligence enables it to understand human speech. It likes to ferry people on its back.

attacks.name: Errand-Running
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Trainer card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Water Splash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Corsola
cards.text: They prefer unpolluted southern seas. Their coral branches lose their color and deteriorate in dirty water.

attacks.name: Spike Cannon
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Suicune

abilities.name: Wind Charm
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, except damage, done to each of your Pokémon. (Existing effects are not removed.)

cards.text: Said to be the embodiment of north winds, it can instantly purify filthy, murky water.

cards.name: Palkia-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Aqua Turbo
attacks.text: Search your deck for 2 Water Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Pearl Hurricane
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Manaphy-EX

abilities.name: Aqua Tube
abilities.text: Each of your Pokémon that has any Water Energy attached to it has no Retreat Cost.

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Mineral Pump
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Tympole
cards.text: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans. It uses the rhythm of these sounds to talk.

attacks.name: Round
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage times the number of your Pokémon in play that have the Round attack.

cards.name: Palpitoad
cards.text: It lives in the water and on land. It uses its long, sticky tongue to immobilize its opponents.

attacks.name: Frog Hop
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Seismitoad
cards.text: They shoot paralyzing liquid from their head bumps. They use vibration to hurt their opponents.

attacks.name: Siphon Off
attacks.text: Attach 3 Energy cards from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Shaky Fall
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused. That Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Ducklett
cards.text: They are better at swimming than flying, and they happily eat their favorite food, peat moss, as they dive underwater.

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Swanna
cards.text: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.

attacks.name: Brave Bird
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

cards.name: Froakie
cards.text: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Frogadier
cards.text: Its swiftness is unparalleled. It can scale a tower of more than 2,000 feet in a minute's time.

attacks.name: Water Duplicates
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Frogadier and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Greninja
cards.text: It appears and vanishes with a ninja's grace. It toys with its enemies using swift movements, while slicing them with throwing stars of sharpest water.

attacks.name: Shadow Stitching
attacks.text: Until the end of your opponent's next turn, each Pokémon your opponent has in play, in his or her hand, and in his or her discard pile has no Abilities. (This includes cards that come into play on that turn.)

attacks.name: Moonlight Slash
attacks.text: You may return a Water Energy from this Pokémon to your hand. If you do, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Greninja BREAK

abilities.name: Giant Water Shuriken
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, you may discard a Water Energy card from your hand. If you do, put 6 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.text: BREAK Evolution Rule: Greninja BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

cards.name: Electabuzz
cards.text: It loves to feed on strong electricity. It occasionally appears around large power plants and so on.

cards.name: Electivire
cards.text: It pushes the tips of its two tails against the foe, then lets loose with over 20,000 volts of power.

cards.name: Shinx
cards.text: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Luxio
cards.text: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.

attacks.name: Thunder Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Luxray
cards.text: Luxray's ability to see through objects comes in handy when it's scouting for danger.

attacks.name: Snarl
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Luxray BREAK
cards.text: BREAK Evolution Rule: Luxray BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

attacks.name: Wild Fury
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 40 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Blitzle
cards.text: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Zebstrika

abilities.name: Zap Zone
abilities.text: Damage from the attacks of your Lightning Pokémon isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.text: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

attacks.name: Crashing Bolt
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has Fighting Resistance, this attack does 60 more damage.

cards.name: Drowzee
cards.text: If you think that you had a good dream but you can't remember it, a Drowzee has probably eaten it.

attacks.name: Focused Wish
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Hypno

abilities.name: Goodnight, Babies
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may leave both Active Pokémon Asleep.

cards.text: Seeing its swinging pendulum can induce sleep in three seconds, even in someone who just woke up.

cards.name: Espeon-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Miraculous Shine
attacks.text: Devolve each of your opponent's evolved Pokémon and put the highest Stage Evolution card on it into your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Skorupi
cards.text: It burrows under the sand to lie in wait for prey. Its tail claws can inject its prey with a savage poison.

attacks.name: Pin Missile
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Drapion
cards.text: It has the power in its clawed arms to make scrap of a car. The tips of its claws release poison.

attacks.name: Poison Claws
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Sigilyph
cards.text: The guardians of an ancient city, they always fly the same route while keeping watch for invaders.

attacks.name: Reflective Shield
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is damaged by an attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 5 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psy Report
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand.

cards.name: Trubbish
cards.text: Inhaling the gas they belch will make you sleep for a week. They prefer unsanitary places.

attacks.name: Acid Spray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Garbodor

abilities.name: Garbotoxin
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, each Pokémon in play, in each player's hand, and in each player's discard pile has no Abilities (except for Garbotoxin).

cards.text: Consuming garbage makes new kinds of poison gases and liquids inside their bodies.

attacks.name: Offensive Bomb
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

cards.name: Espurr
cards.text: It has enough psychic energy to blast everything within 300 feet of itself, but it has no control over its power.

cards.name: Meowstic
cards.text: The eyeball patterns on the interior of its ears emit psychic energy. It keeps the patterns tightly covered because that power is too immense.

attacks.name: Energy Present
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 Energy cards from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Honedge
cards.text: If anyone dares to grab its hilt, it wraps a blue cloth around that person's arm and drains that person's life energy completely.

attacks.name: Stab
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Doublade
cards.text: The complex attack patterns of its two swords are unstoppable, even for an opponent greatly accomplished at swordplay.

attacks.name: Stab Deeply
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Aegislash
cards.text: Apparently, it can detect innate qualities of leadership. According to legend, whoever it recognizes is destined to become king.

attacks.name: Painful Sword
attacks.text: Double the number of damage counters on each of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Megaton Slash
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Skrelp
cards.text: It looks just like rotten kelp. It hides from foes while storing up power for its evolution.

attacks.name: Hide
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Phantump
cards.text: According to old tales, these Pokémon are stumps possessed by the spirits of children who died while lost in the forest.

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon. (This counts as evolving this Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Trevenant

abilities.name: Nervous Seed
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Basic Pokémon's attacks cost Colorless more.

cards.text: Using its roots as a nervous system, it controls the trees in the forest. It's kind to the Pokémon that reside in its body.

attacks.name: Energy Press
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Trevenant BREAK
cards.text: BREAK Evolution Rule: Trevenant BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

attacks.name: Silent Fear
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on each of your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.name: Sudowoodo
cards.text: It disguises itself as a tree to avoid attack. It hates water, so it will disappear if it starts raining.

attacks.name: Watch and Learn
attacks.text: If your opponent's Pokémon used an attack during his or her last turn, use it as this attack.

cards.name: Gible
cards.text: It nests in small, horizontal holes in cave walls. It pounces to catch prey that stray too close.

attacks.name: Never Enough
attacks.text: Discard a card from your hand. If you do, draw 2 cards.

cards.name: Gabite
cards.text: As it digs to expand its nest, it habitually digs up gems that it then hoards in its nest.

attacks.name: Sand Tomb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Garchomp
cards.text: It flies at speeds equals to a jet fighter plane. It never allows its prey to escape.

attacks.name: Turbo Assault
attacks.text: Attach an Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Bite Off
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon-EX, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Pancham
cards.text: It does its level best to glare and pull a scary face, but it can't help grinning if anyone pats its head.

cards.name: Nuzleaf
cards.text: It lives deep in forests. With the leaf on its head, it makes a flute whose song makes listeners uneasy.

attacks.name: Razor Wind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Shiftry
cards.text: By flapping its leafy fan, it can whip up gusts of 100 feet per second that can level houses.

attacks.name: Roll Up
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If any of them are heads, your opponent reveals his or her hand. Then, for each heads, discard a card from your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Otherworldly Return
attacks.text: Put a Trainer card from your discard pile into your hand.

cards.name: Darkrai-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dark Pulse
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Darkness Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dark Head
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Asleep, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Pangoro
cards.text: It charges ahead and bashes its opponents like a berserker, uncaring about any hits it might take. Its arms are mighty enough to snap a telephone pole.

attacks.name: Parting Shot
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 60 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Buster Swing
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

cards.name: Scizor-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Steel Wing
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Gale Thrust
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was on the Bench and became your Active Pokémon this turn, this attack does 60 more damage.

cards.name: M Scizor-EX
cards.text: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.,Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Iron Crusher
attacks.text: You may discard a Special Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon or a Stadium card in play.

cards.name: Mawile
cards.text: Attached to its head is a huge set of jaws formed by horns. It can chew through iron beams.

attacks.name: Tight Jaw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Ferroseed
cards.text: It absorbs the iron it finds in the rock while clinging to the ceiling. It shoots spikes when in danger.

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon would be damaged by an attack, prevent that attack's damage done to this Pokémon if that damage is 60 or less.

cards.name: Ferrothorn
cards.text: They attach themselves to cave ceilings, firing steel spikes at targets passing beneath them.

attacks.name: Spike Lash
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon for each Colorless in that Pokémon's Retreat Cost. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Clefairy
cards.text: The moonlight that it stores in the wings on its back apparently gives it the ability to float in midair.

attacks.name: Sing
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Clefable
cards.text: A timid fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen, it will run and hide the moment it senses people.

attacks.name: Moon Barrier
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by Dragon Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tumbling Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Togekiss-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Mighty Wind
attacks.text: You may attach an Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hurricane Wing
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Spritzee
cards.text: In the past, rather than using perfume, royal ladies carried a Spritzee that would waft a fragrance they liked.

cards.name: Aromatisse
cards.text: Its scent is so overpowering that, unless a Trainer happens to really enjoy the smell, he or she will have a hard time walking alongside it.

attacks.name: Dizzying Cologne
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon-EX, this attack does 40 more damage.

cards.name: Dragalge
cards.text: Tales are told of ships that wander into seas where Dragalge live, never to return.

attacks.name: Severe Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 4 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Dragon Pulse
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your deck.

cards.name: Rattata
cards.text: Its fangs are long and very sharp. They grow continuously, so it gnaws on hard things to whittle them down.

attacks.name: Dangerous Suspicion
attacks.text: Draw a card. Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Raticate

abilities.name: Antibodies
abilities.text: This Pokémon can't be affected by any Special Conditions. (Remove any Special Conditions affecting this Pokémon.)

cards.text: The webs on its hind legs enable it to cross rivers. It searches wide areas for food.

attacks.name: Dirty Shock
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Discard all Pokémon Tool cards attached to that Pokémon.

cards.name: Raticate BREAK
cards.text: BREAK Evolution Rule: Raticate BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

attacks.name: Super Fang
attacks.text: Put damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon until its remaining HP is 10.

cards.name: Dunsparce
cards.text: It digs into the ground with its tail and makes a mazelike nest. It can fly just a little.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Stantler
cards.text: The curved antlers subtly change the flow of air to create a strange space where reality is distorted.

attacks.name: Mystifying Horns
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Big Charge
attacks.text: If you have any Mega Evolution Pokémon on your Bench, this attack does 50 more damage.

cards.name: Ho-Oh-EX

abilities.name: Purifying Fire
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon has any basic Fire Energy attached to it, you may heal 50 damage from it.

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Elemental Feather
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon).

cards.name: Glameow
cards.text: When it's happy, Glameow demonstrates beautiful movements of its tail, like a dancing ribbon.

attacks.name: Act Cute
attacks.text: Your opponent puts a card from his or her hand on the bottom of his or her deck.

cards.name: Purugly
cards.text: To make itself appear intimidatingly beefy, it tightly cinches its waist with its twin tails.

attacks.name: Nyan Press
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage. If tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Furfrou
cards.text: Historically, in the Kalos region, these Pokémon were the designated guardians of the king.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Tight Jaw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: All-Night Party
cards.text: Once during each player's turn, if that player's Active Pokémon is Asleep, he or she may remove that Special Condition and heal 30 damage from that Pokémon.,This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

cards.name: Bursting Balloon
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,If this card is attached to 1 of your Pokémon, discard it at the end of your opponent's turn.,If the Pokémon this card is attached to is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if that Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 6 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.text: You may play 2 Puzzle of Time cards at once. • If you played 1 card, look at the top 3 cards of your deck and put them back in any order. • If you played 2 cards, put 2 cards from your discard pile into your hand.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).
